00035   // Assume we're only going to find spaces in a PDB file...
00036   bool PDB::emptyString(const std::string& s) {
00037     std::string::const_iterator i;
00038 
00039     for (i = s.begin(); i != s.end(); ++i)
00040       if (*i != ' ')
00041         return(false);
00042 
00043     return(true);
00044   }
00045 
00046 
00047   // Special handling for REMARKs to ignore the line code, if
00048   // present... 
00049 
00050   void PDB::parseRemark(const std::string& s) {
00051     std::string t;
00052 
00053     if (s[6] == ' ' && isdigit(s[7]))
00054       t = s.substr(11, 58);
00055     else
00056       t = s.substr(7, 62);
00057 
00058     _remarks.add(t);
00059   }

00062   // Parse an ATOM or HETATM record...
00063 
00064   void PDB::parseAtomRecord(const std::string& s) {
00065     greal r;
00066     gint i;
00067     std::string t;
00068     GCoord c;
00069     pAtom pa(new Atom);
00070   
00071     t = parseStringAs<std::string>(s, 0, 6);
00072     pa->recordName(t);
00073 
00074     i = parseStringAsHybrid36(s, 6, 5);
00075     pa->id(i);
00076 
00077     t = parseStringAs<std::string>(s, 12, 4);
00078     pa->name(t);
00079 
00080     t = parseStringAs<std::string>(s, 16, 1);
00081     pa->altLoc(t);
00082 
00083     t = parseStringAs<std::string>(s, 17, 4);
00084     pa->resname(t);
00085 
00086     t = parseStringAs<std::string>(s, 21, 1);
00087     pa->chainId(t);
00088 
00089     i = parseStringAsHybrid36(s, 22, 4);
00090     pa->resid(i);
00091   
00092     t = parseStringAs<std::string>(s, 26, 1);
00093 
00094     // Special handling of resid field since it may be frame-shifted by
00095     // 1 col in some cases...
00096     if (strictness_policy) {
00097       char c = t[0];
00098     
00099       if (c != ' ' && !isalpha(c))
00100         throw(std::runtime_error("Non-alpha character in iCode column of PDB"));
00101     } else {
00102       char c = t[0];
00103 
00104       // Assume that if we see this variant, then we're not using hybrid-36
00105       if (c != ' ' && isdigit(c)) {
00106         i = parseStringAs<int>(s, 22, 5);
00107         pa->resid(i);
00108         t = " ";
00109       }
00110 
00111     }
00112     pa->iCode(t);
00113 
00114     c[0] = parseStringAs<float>(s, 30, 8);
00115     c[1] = parseStringAs<float>(s, 38, 8);
00116     c[2] = parseStringAs<float>(s, 46, 8);
00117     pa->coords(c);
00118   
00119     r = parseStringAs<float>(s, 54, 6);
00120     pa->occupancy(r);
00121 
00122     r = parseStringAs<float>(s, 60, 6);
00123     pa->bfactor(r);
00124 
00125     t = parseStringAs<std::string>(s, 72, 4);
00126     pa->segid(t);
00127 
00128     t = parseStringAs<std::string>(s, 76, 2);
00129     pa->PDBelement(t);
00130 
00131 
00132     // Charge is not currently handled...
00133     t = parseStringAs<std::string>(s, 78, 2);
00134 
00135     append(pa);
00136   }

00140   // Convert an Atom to a string with a PDB format...
00141 
00142   std::string PDB::atomAsString(const pAtom p) const {
00143     std::ostringstream s;
00144 
00145     // Float formatter for coords
00146     Fmt crdfmt(3);
00147     crdfmt.width(8);
00148     crdfmt.right();
00149     crdfmt.trailingZeros(true);
00150     crdfmt.fixed();
00151 
00152     // Float formatter for B's and Q's...
00153     Fmt bqfmt(2);
00154     bqfmt.width(6);
00155     bqfmt.right();
00156     bqfmt.trailingZeros(true);
00157     bqfmt.fixed();
00158 
00159     // We don't worry about strings exceeding field-widths (yet),
00160     // but do check for numeric overflows...
00161     s << std::setw(6) << std::left << p->recordName();
00162     s << hybrid36AsString(p->id(), 5) << " ";
00163     s << std::setw(4) << std::left << p->name();
00164 
00165     s << std::setw(1) << p->altLoc();
00166     s << std::setw(4) << std::left << p->resname();
00167     
00168     s << std::setw(1) << std::right << p->chainId();
00169     s << hybrid36AsString(p->resid(), 4);
00170     s << std::setw(2) << p->iCode();
00171     s << "  ";
00172         
00173     s << crdfmt(p->coords().x());
00174     s << crdfmt(p->coords().y());
00175     s << crdfmt(p->coords().z());
00176     s << bqfmt(p->occupancy());
00177     s << bqfmt(p->bfactor());
00178     s << "      ";
00179     s << std::setw(4) << std::left << p->segid();
00180     s << std::setw(2) << std::right << p->PDBelement();
00181     if (_show_charge)
00182       s << std::setw(2) << p->charge();
00183     else
00184       s << "  ";
00185 
00186     return(s.str());
00187   }

00190   // Parse CONECT records, updating the referenced atoms...
00191   // Couple of issues:
00192   //
00193   //    Will accept up to 8 bound atoms and considers them all equal,
00194   // but the PDB standard says some are h-bonded and some are
00195   // salt-bridged... 
00196   //
00197   //    No check is made for overflow of fields...
00198 
00199   void PDB::parseConectRecord(const std::string& s) {
00200     int bound_id = parseStringAs<int>(s, 6, 5);
00201     pAtom bound = findById(bound_id);
00202     if (bound == 0)
00203       throw(PDB::BadConnectivity("Cannot find primary atom " + s.substr(6, 5)));
00204 
00205     // This currently includes fields designated as H-bond indices...
00206     // Should we do this? or separate them out?  Hmmm...
00207     for (int i=0; i<8; ++i) {
00208       int j = i * 5 + 11;
00209       std::string t = s.substr(j, 5);
00210       if (emptyString(t))
00211         break;
00212       int id = parseStringAsHybrid36(t);
00213       pAtom boundee = findById(id);
00214       if (boundee == 0)
00215         throw(PDB::BadConnectivity("Cannot find bound atom " + t));
00216       bound->addBond(boundee);
00217     }
00218   }

00221   void PDB::parseCryst1Record(const std::string& s) {
00222     greal r;
00223     gint i;
00224     std::string t;
00225 
00226     r = parseStringAs<float>(s, 6, 9);
00227     cell.a(r);
00228     r = parseStringAs<float>(s, 15, 9);
00229     cell.b(r);
00230     r = parseStringAs<float>(s, 24, 9);
00231     cell.c(r);
00232     
00233     r = parseStringAs<float>(s, 33, 7);
00234     cell.alpha(r);
00235     r = parseStringAs<float>(s, 40, 7);
00236     cell.beta(r);
00237     r = parseStringAs<float>(s, 47, 7);
00238     cell.gamma(r);
00239     
00240     try {
00241       // Special handling in case of mangled CRYST1 record...
00242       if (s.length() < 66) {
00243         t = s.substr(55);
00244         
00245         cell.spaceGroup(t);
00246         cell.z(-1);   // ??? 
00247       } else {
00248         t = parseStringAs<std::string>(s, 55, 11);
00249         cell.spaceGroup(t);
00250         i = parseStringAs<int>(s, 66, 4);
00251         cell.z(i);
00252       }
00253     }
00254     catch (...) {
00255       std::cerr << "Error while parsing space group in CRYST1 record." << std::endl;
00256       throw;
00257     }
00258       
00259     _has_cryst = true;
00260   }
00261 
00262 
00265   void PDB::read(std::istream& is) {
00266     std::string input;
00267     bool has_cryst = false;
00268     std::tr1::unordered_set<std::string> seen;
00269 
00270     while (getline(is, input)) {
00271       if (input.substr(0, 4) == "ATOM" || input.substr(0,6) == "HETATM")
00272         parseAtomRecord(input);
00273       else if (input.substr(0, 6) == "REMARK")
00274         parseRemark(input);
00275       else if (input.substr(0,6) == "CONECT")
00276         parseConectRecord(input);
00277       else if (input.substr(0, 6) == "CRYST1") {
00278         parseCryst1Record(input);
00279         has_cryst = true;
00280       } else if (input.substr(0,3) == "TER")
00281         ;
00282       else if (input.substr(0,3) == "END")
00283         break;
00284       else {
00285         int space = input.find_first_of(' ');
00286         std::string record = input.substr(0, space);
00287         if (seen.find(record) == seen.end()) {
00288           std::cerr << "Warning - unknown PDB record '" << record << "'" << std::endl;
00289           seen.insert(record);
00290         }
00291       }
00292     }
00293 
00294     // Do some post-extraction...
00295     if (loos::remarksHasBox(_remarks)) {
00296       GCoord c = loos::boxFromRemarks(_remarks);
00297       periodicBox(c);
00298     } else if (has_cryst) {
00299       GCoord c(cell.a(), cell.b(), cell.c());
00300       periodicBox(c);
00301     }
00302 
00303     // Force atom id's to be monotonic if there was an overflow event...
00304     if (atoms.size() >= 100000)
00305       renumber();
00306   }

00309   std::ostream& FormattedUnitCell(std::ostream& os, const UnitCell& u) {
00310     os << "CRYST1";
00311     Fmt dists(3);
00312     dists.width(9).right().trailingZeros(true).fixed();
00313     Fmt angles(2);
00314     angles.width(7).right().trailingZeros(true).fixed();
00315 
00316     os << dists(u.a()) << dists(u.b()) << dists(u.c());
00317     os << angles(u.alpha()) << angles(u.beta()) << angles(u.gamma());
00318     os << " " << std::setw(11) << std::left << u.spaceGroup() << std::setw(4) << u.z();
00319 
00320     return(os);
00321   }
00322 
00323   std::ostream& XTALLine(std::ostream& os, const GCoord& box) {
00324     os << "REMARK  XTAL "
00325        << box.x() << " "
00326        << box.y() << " "
00327        << box.z();
00328     return(os);
00329   }

00331 
00332   std::ostream& FormatConectRecords(std::ostream& os, PDB& p) {
00333     AtomicGroup::iterator ci;
00334 
00335     // We first have to make sure that the base AtomicGroup is sorted
00336     // since we will be verifying bound atoms exist by searching for
00337     // their ID...this would force a sort while we have iterators
00338     // pointing to the vector of atoms which would be bad...
00339     p.sort();
00340   
00341     for (ci = p.atoms.begin(); ci != p.atoms.end(); ++ci) {
00342       if ((*ci)->checkProperty(Atom::bondsbit)) {
00343         int donor = (*ci)->id();
00344 
00345         os << "CONECT" << hybrid36AsString(donor, 5);
00346         int i = 0;
00347 
00348         std::vector<int> bonds = (*ci)->getBonds();
00349         std::vector<int>::const_iterator cj;
00350         for (cj = bonds.begin(); cj != bonds.end(); ++cj) {
00351           if (++i > 4) {
00352             i = 1;
00353             os << "\nCONECT" << hybrid36AsString(donor, 5);
00354           }
00355           int bound_id = *cj;
00356           pAtom pa = p.findById(bound_id);
00357           if (pa != 0)
00358             os << hybrid36AsString(bound_id, 5);
00359         }
00360         os << std::endl;
00361       }
00362     }
00363 
00364     return(os);
00365   }
00366

00369 
00377   std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, PDB& p) {
00378     AtomicGroup::iterator i;
00379 
00380     os << p._remarks;
00381     if (p.isPeriodic()) 
00382       XTALLine(os, p.periodicBox()) << std::endl;
00383     if (p._has_cryst) 
00384       FormattedUnitCell(os, p.cell) << std::endl;
00385     for (i = p.atoms.begin(); i != p.atoms.end(); ++i)
00386       os << p.atomAsString(*i) << std::endl;
00387 
00388     if (p.hasBonds()) {
00389       int maxid = 0;
00390       for (i = p.atoms.begin(); i != p.atoms.end(); ++i)
00391         if ((*i)->id() > maxid)
00392           maxid = (*i)->id();
00393 
00394       if (maxid <= 99999)
00395         FormatConectRecords(os, p);
00396     }
00397   
00398     if (p._auto_ter)
00399       os << "TER     \n";
00400 
00401     return(os);
00402   }

00404   PDB PDB::copy(void) const {
00405     AtomicGroup grp = this->AtomicGroup::copy();
00406     PDB p(grp);
00407     
00408     p._show_charge = _show_charge;
00409     p._auto_ter = _auto_ter;
00410     p._has_cryst = _has_cryst;
00411     p._remarks = _remarks;
00412     p.cell = cell;
00413     
00414     return(p);
00415   }
00416 
00417   PDB* PDB::clone(void) const {
00418     return(new PDB(*this));
00419   }
00420 
00421   PDB PDB::fromAtomicGroup(const AtomicGroup& g) {
00422     PDB p(g);
00423 
00424     if (p.isPeriodic()) 
00425       p.unitCell(UnitCell(p.periodicBox()));
00426     
00427     return(p);
00428   }
